Rover:FORMAT_VERSION.description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

Rover:LOG_BITMASK.description: Bitmap of what log types to enable in on-board logger. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. On boards supporting microSD cards or other large block-storage devices it is usually best just to enable all basic log types by setting this to 65535.

Rover:RST_SWITCH_CH.description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

Rover:INITIAL_MODE.description: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usually used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

Rover:GCS_PID_MASK.description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

Rover:AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN.description: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

Rover:AUTO_KICKSTART.description: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

Rover:CRUISE_SPEED.display_name: Target cruise speed in auto modes
Rover:CRUISE_SPEED.description: The target speed in auto missions.

Rover:CRUISE_THROTTLE.description: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

Rover:FS_ACTION.description: What to do on a failsafe event

Rover:FS_TIMEOUT.description: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition must persist before the failsafe action is triggered

Rover:FS_THR_ENABLE.description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

Rover:FS_THR_VALUE.description: The PWM level on the throttle channel below which throttle failsafe triggers.

Rover:FS_GCS_ENABLE.description: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

Rover:FS_CRASH_CHECK.description: What to do on a crash event. When enabled the rover will go to hold if a crash is detected.

Rover:FS_EKF_ACTION.description: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

Rover:FS_EKF_THRESH.description: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

Rover:MODE_CH.description: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

Rover:MODE1.description: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

Rover:MODE2.description: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

Rover:MODE3.description: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

Rover:MODE4.description: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

Rover:MODE5.description: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

Rover:MODE6.description: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

Rover:TURN_RADIUS.description: Turn radius of vehicle in meters while at low speeds.  Lower values produce tighter turns in steering mode

Rover:RTL_SPEED.description: Return-to-Launch speed default.  If zero use WP_SPEED or CRUISE_SPEED.

Rover:BAL_PITCH_MAX.description: Pitch angle in degrees at 100% throttle

Rover:CRASH_ANGLE.description: Pitch/Roll angle limit in degrees for crash check. Zero disables check

Rover:LOIT_TYPE.description: Loiter behaviour when moving to the target point

Rover:LOIT_RADIUS.description: Vehicle will drift when within this distance of the target position

Rover:BAL_PITCH_TRIM.description: Balance Bot pitch trim for balancing. This offsets the tilt of the center of mass.

Rover:STICK_MIXING.description: When enabled, this adds steering user stick input in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of control without changing modes.

Rover:SPEED_MAX.description: Maximum speed vehicle can obtain at full throttle. If 0, it will be estimated based on CRUISE_SPEED and CRUISE_THROTTLE.

Rover:LOIT_SPEED_GAIN.description: Determines how aggressively LOITER tries to correct for drift from loiter point. Higher is faster but default should be acceptable.

Rover:GUID_OPTIONS.description: Options that can be applied to change guided mode behaviour

Rover:MANUAL_STR_EXPO.description: Manual steering expo to allow faster steering when stick at edges

Rover:FS_GCS_TIMEOUT.description: Timeout before triggering the GCS failsafe

Rover:CH7_OPTION.description: What to do use channel 7 for

Rover:AUX_CH.description: RC Channel to use for auxiliary functions including saving waypoints

Rover:PIVOT_TURN_ANGLE.description: Navigation angle threshold in degrees to switch to pivot steering. This allows you to setup a skid steering rover to turn on the spot in auto mode when the angle it needs to turn it greater than this angle. An angle of zero means to disable pivot turning. Note that you will probably also want to set a low value for WP_RADIUS to get neat turns.

Rover:PIVOT_TURN_RATE.description: Desired pivot turn rate in deg/s.

FLTMODE_GCSBLOCK.description: Bitmask of flight modes to disable for GCS selection. Mode can still be accessed via RC or failsafe.

VID1_IPADDR0.description: Video stream IP Address first octet

VID1_IPADDR1.description: Video stream IP Address second octet

VID1_IPADDR2.description: Video stream IP Address third octet

VID1_IPADDR3.description: Video stream IP Address fourth octet

VID1_IPPORT.display_name: Camera1 Video Stream IP Address Port

BTAG_CUR_CYCLES.description: this is the highest value for battery cycles for all connected batteries

FOLT_MAV_CHAN.description: MAVLink channel to which FOLLOW_TARGET should be sent

WINCH_RC_FUNC.description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control winch rate

PLND_ALT_CUTOFF.description: The altitude (rangefinder distance) below which we stop using the precision landing sensor and continue landing

DIST_CUTOFF.description: The distance from target beyond which the target is ignored

SLUP_VEL_P.description: Slung Payload Velocity P gain, higher values will result in faster movements in sync with payload

SLUP_DIST_MAX.description: Oscillation is suppressed when vehicle and payload are no more than this distance horizontally.  Set to 0 to always suppress

SLUP_SYSID.description: Slung Payload mavlink system id.  0 to use any/all system ids

SLUP_WP_POS_P.display_name: Slung Payload return to WP position P gain
SLUP_WP_POS_P.description: WP position P gain. higher values will result in vehicle moving more quickly back to the original waypoint

SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.display_name: Slung Payload resting offset estimate filter time constant
SLUP_RESTOFS_TC.description: payload's position estimator's time constant used to compensate for GPS errors and wind.  Higher values result in smoother estimate but slower response

SLUP_DEBUG.description: Slung payload debug output, set to 1 to enable debug

THR_KILL_FUNC.description: AUX function to kill engine. This can be activated either with a RCn_OPTION and a R/C switch or with a ground station auxilliary function

THR_KILL_CHAN.display_name: output channel to change on throttle kill
THR_KILL_CHAN.description: output channel to change on throttle kill, a value of zero disables the feature

THR_KILL_VAL.description: auxilliary value to kill throttle. Set to 2 to kill the throttle when the auxilliary is high. Set to 0 to kill when auxilliary is low

THR_KILL_DEF.description: throttle kill default value. The default auxilliary function position on boot

CGA_RATIO.description: The ratio between the front and back motor outputs during steady-state hover. Positive when the CoG is in front of the motors midpoint (front motors work harder).

RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.display_name: Rover Quicktune Steering Rate FeedForward ratio
RTUN_STR_FFRATIO.description: Ratio between measured response and FF gain. Raise this to get a higher FF gain

RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.display_name: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to P ratio
RTUN_STR_P_RATIO.description: Ratio between steering FF and P gains. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.display_name: Rover Quicktune Steering FF to I ratio
RTUN_STR_I_RATIO.description: Ratio between steering FF and I gains. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

RTUN_SPD_FFRATIO.description: Ratio between measured response and CRUISE_THROTTLE value. Raise this to get a higher CRUISE_THROTTLE value

RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.display_name: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to P ratio
RTUN_SPD_P_RATIO.description: Ratio between speed FF and P gain. Raise this to get a higher P gain, 0 to leave P unchanged

RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.display_name: Rover Quicktune Speed FF to I ratio
RTUN_SPD_I_RATIO.description: Ratio between speed FF and I gain. Raise this to get a higher I gain, 0 to leave I unchanged

RTUN_AUTO_FILTER.description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

RTUN_AUTO_SAVE.description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

RTUN_RC_FUNC.description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

RTUN_SPEED_MIN.display_name: Rover Quicktune minimum speed for tuning
RTUN_SPEED_MIN.description: The mimimum speed in m/s required for tuning to start

ESRC_EXTN_THRESH.description: ExternalNav may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_EXTN_QUAL.description: ExternalNav may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_THRESH.description: OpticalFlow may be used if innovations are below this threshold

ESRC_FLOW_QUAL.description: OpticalFlow may be used if quality is above this threshold

ESRC_RNGFND_MAX.description: OpticalFlow may be used if rangefinder distance is below this threshold

WEB_BLOCK_SIZE.description: web server block size for download

WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.display_name: web server minimum file size for sendfile
WEB_SENDFILE_MIN.description: sendfile is an offloading mechanism for faster file download. If this is non-zero and the file is larger than this size then sendfile will be used for file download

TA_ACT_FN.description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Terrain Avoidance enable/disable

TA_PTCH_DWN_MIN.description: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

TA_PTCH_FWD_MIN.description: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Pitching up to gain altitude.

TA_QUAD_DWN_MIN.description: If the downward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

TA_QUAD_FWD_MIN.description: If the farwardward distance is less than this value then start Quading up to gain altitude.

TA_PTCH_GSP_MIN.description: Minimum Groundspeed (not airspeed) to be flying for Pitching to be used.

TA_PTCH_TIMEOUT.description: Minimum down or forward distance must be triggered for more than this many seconds to start Pitching

TA_HOME_DIST.description: Terrain avoidance will not be applied if the vehicle is less than this distance from home

TA_ALT_MAX.description: This is a limit on how high the terrain avoidane will take the vehicle. It acts a failsafe to prevent vertical flyaways.

TA_GSP_MAX.description: This is a limit on how fast in groundspeeed terrain avoidance will take the vehicle. This is to allow for reliable sensor readings. -1 for disabled.

TA_GSP_AIRBRAKE.description: This is the limit for triggering airbrake to slow groundspeed as a difference between the airspeed and groundspeed. -1 for disabled.

TA_CMTC_HGT.description: The minimum Height above terrain to maintain when following an AUTO mission or RTL. If zero(0) use TA_PTCH_DOW_MIN.

TA_CMTC_ENABLE.description: Whether to enable Can't Make That Climb while running Terrain Avoidance

TA_CMTC_RAD.description: Use this radius for the loiter when trying to gain altitude. If not set or <=0 use WP_LOITER_RAD

ALAND_WP_ALT.description: Altitude of final approach waypoint created by script

ALAND_WP_DIST.description: Distance from landing point (HOME) to final approach waypoint created by script in the opposite direction of initial takeoff

AHRS_ORIG_LAT.description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this latitude if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_LON.description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this longitude if not already set

AHRS_ORIG_ALT.description: AHRS/EKF origin will be set to this altitude (in meters above sea level) if not already set

QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME.description: Time to double a tuning parameter. Raise this for a slower tune.

QUIK_GAIN_MARGIN.description: Reduction in gain after oscillation detected. Raise this number to get a more conservative tune

QUIK_OSC_SMAX.description: Threshold for oscillation detection. A lower value will lead to a more conservative tune.

QUIK_YAW_P_MAX.description: Maximum value for yaw P gain

QUIK_YAW_D_MAX.description: Maximum value for yaw D gain

QUIK_RP_PI_RATIO.description: Ratio between P and I gains for roll and pitch. Raise this to get a lower I gain

QUIK_Y_PI_RATIO.description: Ratio between P and I gains for yaw. Raise this to get a lower I gain

QUIK_AUTO_FILTER.description: When enabled the PID filter settings are automatically set based on INS_GYRO_FILTER

QUIK_AUTO_SAVE.description: Number of seconds after completion of tune to auto-save. This is useful when using a 2 position switch for quicktune

QUIK_RC_FUNC.description: RCn_OPTION number to use to control tuning stop/start/save

QUIK_MAX_REDUCE.description: This controls how much quicktune is allowed to lower gains from the original gains. If the vehicle already has a reasonable tune and is not oscillating then you can set this to zero to prevent gain reductions. The default of 20% is reasonable for most vehicles. Using a maximum gain reduction lowers the chance of an angle P oscillation happening if quicktune gets a false positive oscillation at a low gain, which can result in very low rate gains and a dangerous angle P oscillation.

QUIK_OPTIONS.description: Additional options. When the Two Position Switch option is enabled then a high switch position will start the tune, low will disable the tune. you should also set a QUIK_AUTO_SAVE time so that you will be able to save the tune.

QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.display_name: maximum angle error for tune abort
QUIK_ANGLE_MAX.description: If while tuning the angle error goes over this limit then the tune will aborts to prevent a bad oscillation in the case of the tuning algorithm failing. If you get an error "Tuning: attitude error ABORTING" and you think it is a false positive then you can either raise this parameter or you can try increasing the QUIK_DOUBLE_TIME to do the tune more slowly. A value of zero disables this check.

PREV_RC_FUNC.description: RCn_OPTION number to used to trigger parameter reversion

RCK_FORCEHL.description: Automatically enables High Latency mode if not already enabled

RCK_PERIOD.description: When in High Latency mode, send Rockblock updates every N seconds

RCK_DEBUG.description: Sends Rockblock debug text to GCS via statustexts

RCK_ENABLE.description: Enables the Rockblock sending and recieving

RCK_TIMEOUT.display_name: GCS timeout to start sendin Rockblock messages
RCK_TIMEOUT.description: If RCK_FORCEHL=2, this is the number of seconds of GCS timeout until High Latency mode is auto-enabled

FOLLP_FAIL_MODE.description: Mode to switch to if the target is lost (no signal or > FOLL_DIST_MAX).

FOLLP_EXIT_MODE.description: Mode to switch to when follow mode is exited normally

FOLLP_ACT_FN.description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for Plane Follow enable/disable

FOLLP_TIMEOUT.description: How long to try reaquire a target if telemetry from the lead vehicle is lost.

FOLLP_OVRSHT_DEG.description: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume an overshoot

FOLLP_TURN_DEG.description: If the target is greater than this many degrees left or right, assume it's turning

FOLLP_DIST_CLOSE.description: When closer than this distance assume we track by heading

FOLLP_WIDE_TURNS.description: Use wide turns when following a turning target. Alternative is "cutting the corner"

FOLLP_ALT.description: When non zero, this altitude value (in FOLL_ALT_TYPE frame) overrides the value sent by the target vehicle

FOLLP_D_P.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting distance P gain
FOLLP_D_P.description: P gain for the speed PID controller distance component

FOLLP_D_I.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting distance I gain
FOLLP_D_I.description: I gain for the speed PID  distance component

FOLLP_D_D.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting distance D gain
FOLLP_D_D.description: D gain for the speed PID controller distance component

FOLLP_V_P.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting speed P gain
FOLLP_V_P.description: P gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

FOLLP_V_I.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting speed I gain
FOLLP_V_I.description: I gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

FOLLP_V_D.display_name: Plane Follow Scripting speed D gain
FOLLP_V_D.description: D gain for the speed PID controller velocity component

FOLLP_LkAHD.description: Time to "lookahead" when calculating distance errors

FOLLP_SIM_TLF_FN.display_name: Plane Follow Simulate Telemetry fail function
FOLLP_SIM_TLF_FN.description: Set this switch to simulate losing telemetry from the other vehicle

FOLLP_XT_P.display_name: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller P term
FOLLP_XT_P.description: P term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

FOLLP_XT_I.display_name: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller I term
FOLLP_XT_I.description: I term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

FOLLP_XT_D.display_name: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller D term
FOLLP_XT_D.description: D term for the crosstrack/heading PID controller

FOLLP_XT_MAX.display_name: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum correction
FOLLP_XT_MAX.description: maximum correction retured by the crosstrack/heading PID controller

FOLLP_XT_I_MAX.display_name: Plane Follow crosstrack PID controller maximum integral
FOLLP_XT_I_MAX.description: maximum I applied the crosstrack/heading PID controller

FOLLP_REFRESH.description: refresh rate for Plane Follow updates

POI_DIST_MAX.description: POI's max distance (in meters) from the vehicle

ARM_SYSID.description: Check that MAV_SYSID (or SYDID_THISMAV) has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_SYSID.description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID has been set. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_SYSID_X.description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1, check that FOLL_SYSID is different to MAV_SYSID. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FOLL_OFS_DEF.description: Follow offsets should not be left as default (zero) if FOLL_ENABLE = 1. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_MNTX_SYSID.display_name: Follow and Mount should follow the same vehicle
ARM_MNTX_SYSID.description: If FOLL_ENABLE = 1 and MNTx_SYSID_DEFLT is set, check that FOLL_SYSID is equal MNTx. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_RTL_CLIMB.display_name: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be a valid value
ARM_RTL_CLIMB.description: RTL_CLIMB_MIN should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_ESTOP.description: Emergency Stop disables arming. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_FENCE.description: Fences loaded but no fence enabled. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_RALLY.description: Rally Point more than RALLY_LIMIT_KM kilometers away. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_C_RTL_ALT.display_name: RTL_ALT should be a valid value
ARM_C_RTL_ALT.description: RTL_ALT should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_Q_FS_LAND.display_name: Warn if Q failsafe will land
ARM_P_Q_FS_LAND.description: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will land. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_Q_FS_RTL.display_name: Warn if Q failsafe will QRTL
ARM_P_Q_FS_RTL.description: Notify the user that on failsafe a QuadPlan will QRTL. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_AIRSPEED.description: Validate that AIRSPEED_STALL(if set) < MIN < CRUISE < MAX d. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_STALL.description: Validate that AIRSPEED_MIN is at least 25% above AIRSPEED_STALL(if set). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_SCALING.description: Validate that SCALING_SPEED is within 20% of AIRSPEED_CRUISE. If SCALING_SPEED changes the vehicle may need to be retuned. 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_RTL_ALT.display_name: RTL_ALTITUDE should be a valid value
ARM_P_RTL_ALT.description: RTL_ALTITITUDE should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_P_QRTL_ALT.display_name: Q_RTL_ALT should be a valid value
ARM_P_QRTL_ALT.description: Q_RTL_ALT should be < 120m (400ft). 3 or less to prevent arming. -1 to disable.

ARM_V_ALT_LEGAL.description: Legal max altitude for UAV/RPAS/drones in your jurisdiction

TERR_BRK_ALT.description: terrain brake altitude. The altitude above the ground below which BRAKE mode will be engaged if in LOITER mode.

TERR_BRK_HDIST.description: terrain brake home distance. The distance from home where the auto BRAKE will be enabled. When within this distance of home the script will not activate

TERR_BRK_SPD.description: terrain brake speed threshold. Don't trigger BRAKE if both horizontal speed and descent rate are below this threshold. By setting this to a small value this can be used to allow the user to climb up to a safe altitude in LOITER mode. A value of 0.5 is recommended if you want to use LOITER to recover from an emergency terrain BRAKE mode change.

DR_ENABLE_DIST.description: Distance from home (in meters) beyond which the dead reckoning will be enabled

DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.display_name: Deadreckoning GPS speed accuracy maximum threshold
DR_GPS_SACC_MAX.description: GPS speed accuracy maximum, above which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 0.8).  Lower values trigger with good GPS quality, higher values will allow poorer GPS before triggering. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS speed accuracy

DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.display_name: Deadreckoning GPS satellite count min threshold
DR_GPS_SAT_MIN.description: GPS satellite count threshold below which deadreckoning home will begin (default is 6).  Higher values trigger with good GPS quality, Lower values trigger with worse GPS quality. Set to 0 to disable use of GPS satellite count

DR_GPS_TRIGG_SEC.description: GPS checks must fail for this many seconds before dead reckoning will be triggered

DR_FLY_ALT_MIN.description: Copter will fly at at least this altitude (in meters) above home during deadreckoning

DR_FLY_TIMEOUT.description: Copter will attempt to switch to NEXT_MODE after this many seconds of deadreckoning.  If it cannot switch modes it will continue in Guided_NoGPS.  Set to 0 to disable timeout

DR_NEXT_MODE.description: Copter switch to this mode after GPS recovers or DR_FLY_TIMEOUT has elapsed.  Default is 6/RTL.  Set to -1 to return to mode used before deadreckoning was triggered

SHIP_LAND_ANGLE.description: Angle from the stern of the ship for landing approach. Use this to ensure that on a go-around that ship superstructure and cables are avoided. A value of zero means to approach from the rear of the ship. A value of 90 means the landing will approach from the port (left) side of the ship. A value of -90 will mean approaching from the starboard (right) side of the ship. A value of 180 will approach from the bow of the ship. This parameter is combined with the sign of the RTL_RADIUS parameter to determine the holdoff pattern. If RTL_RADIUS is positive then a clockwise loiter is performed, if RTL_RADIUS is negative then a counter-clockwise loiter is used.

SHIP_AUTO_OFS.description: Settings this parameter to one triggers an automatic follow offset calculation based on current position of the vehicle and the landing target. NOTE: This parameter will auto-reset to zero once the offset has been calculated.

AEROM_ANG_TC.description: This is the time over which we filter the desired roll to smooth it

AEROM_THR_PIT_FF.description: This controls how much extra throttle to add based on pitch ange. The value is for 90 degrees and is applied in proportion to pitch

AEROM_SPD_P.description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_SPD_I.description: This controls how rapidly the throttle is raised to compensate for a speed error

AEROM_ROL_COR_TC.description: This is the time constant for correcting roll errors. A smaller value leads to faster roll corrections

AEROM_TIME_COR_P.display_name: Time constant for correction of our distance along the path
AEROM_TIME_COR_P.description: This is the time constant for correcting path position errors

AEROM_ERR_COR_P.display_name: P gain for path error corrections
AEROM_ERR_COR_P.description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

AEROM_ERR_COR_D.display_name: D gain for path error corrections
AEROM_ERR_COR_D.description: This controls how rapidly we correct back onto the desired path

AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.display_name: The roll rate to use when entering a roll maneuver
AEROM_ENTRY_RATE.description: This controls how rapidly we roll into a new orientation

AEROM_THR_LKAHD.description: This controls how far ahead we look in time along the path for the target throttle

AEROM_DEBUG.description: This controls the printing of extra debug information on paths

AEROM_THR_BOOST.description: This is the extra throttle added in schedule elements marked as needing a throttle boost

AEROM_YAW_ACCEL.description: This is maximum yaw acceleration to use

AEROM_LKAHD.description: This is how much time to look ahead in the path for calculating path rates

AEROM_PATH_SCALE.description: Scale factor for Path/Box size. 0.5 would half the distances in maneuvers. Radii are unaffected.

AEROM_STALL_THR.description: Amount of throttle to reduce to for a stall turn

AEROM_STALL_PIT.description: Pitch threashold for moving to final stage of stall turn

AEROM_KE_RUDD.description: Percent of rudder normally uses to sustain knife-edge at trick speed

AEROM_KE_RUDD_LK.description: Time to look ahead in the path to calculate rudder correction for bank angle

AEROM_ALT_ABORT.description: Maximum allowable loss in altitude during a trick or sequence from its starting altitude.

AEROM_TS_P.description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_I.description: This controls how rapidly two aircraft are brought back into time sync

AEROM_TS_SPDMAX.description: This sets the maximum speed adjustment for time sync between aircraft

AEROM_TS_RATE.display_name: Timesync rate of send of NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT data
AEROM_TS_RATE.description: This sets the rate we send data for time sync between aircraft

AEROM_MIS_ANGLE.description: When set to a non-zero value, this is the assumed direction of the mission. Otherwise the waypoint angle is used

TRIK_ENABLE.description: Enables Tricks on Switch. TRIK params hidden until enabled

TRIK_SEL_FN.description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick selection

TRIK_ACT_FN.description: Setting an RC channel's _OPTION to this value will use it for trick action (abort,announce,execute)

TRIK_COUNT.description: Number of tricks which can be selected over the range of the trik selection RC channel

EFI_HFE_ECU_IDX.description: HFI EFI ECU index, 0 for automatic

EFI_HFE_FUEL_DTY.description: HFI EFI fuel density in gram per litre

EFI_H6K_CANDRV.description: Halo6000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_H6K_START_FN.description: The RC auxilliary function number for start/stop of the generator. Zero to disable start function

EFI_H6K_TELEM_RT.description: The rate that additional generator telemetry is sent

EFI_H6K_FUELTOT.description: The capacity of the tank in litres

VIEP_CAM_SWLOW.description: Camera selection when switch is in low position

VIEP_CAM_SWMID.description: Camera selection when switch is in middle position

VIEP_CAM_SWHIGH.description: Camera selection when switch is in high position

VIEP_ZOOM_SPEED.description: ViewPro Zoom Speed.  Higher numbers result in faster zooming

EFI_2K_CANDRV.description: NMEA 2000 CAN driver. Use 1 for first CAN scripting driver, 2 for 2nd driver

EFI_SP_THR_FN.description: SkyPower EFI throttle function. This sets which SERVOn_FUNCTION to use for the target throttle. This should be 70 for fixed wing aircraft and 31 for helicopter rotor speed control

EFI_SP_THR_RATE.description: SkyPower EFI throttle rate. This sets rate at which throttle updates are sent to the engine

EFI_SP_START_FN.description: SkyPower EFI start function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling engine start

EFI_SP_GEN_FN.description: SkyPower EFI generator control function. This is the RCn_OPTION value to use to find the R/C channel used for controlling generator start/stop

EFI_SP_MIN_RPM.description: SkyPower EFI minimum RPM. This is the RPM below which the engine is considered to be stopped

EFI_SP_TLM_RT.description: SkyPower EFI telemetry rate. This is the rate at which extra telemetry values are sent to the GCS

EFI_SP_LOG_RT.description: SkyPower EFI log rate. This is the rate at which extra logging of the SkyPower EFI is performed

EFI_SP_ST_DISARM.description: SkyPower EFI allow start disarmed. This controls if starting the engine while disarmed is allowed

EFI_SP_RST_TIME.description: SkyPower EFI restart time. If engine should be running and it has stopped for this amount of time then auto-restart. To disable this feature set this value to zero.

EFI_DLA_LPS.description: EFI DLA litres of fuel per second of injection time

EFI_SVF_ARMCHECK.description: Check for Generator ARM state before arming

ENABLE.description: When set to 0 this script will not run. When set to 1 this script will run.

BATT_IDX.description: Ensure this battery is configured with `BATT*_MONITOR=29`.

CFACT.description: This is multiplicative factor to correct the measured flow. Set to <1 if your sensor measures too high.

MODE.description: 0: The sensor will save the fuel consumption across power resets. 1: The sensor will reset the power consumption.

PORT.description: Which Scripting serial port the sensor is connected at.

EFI_INF_IGN_AUX.description: EFI INF throttle ignition aux function

LTE_ENABLE.description: Enable or disable the LTE modem driver

LTE_SERPORT.description: Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SERIALn_ ports that are set to 28 for "scripting"

LTE_SCRPORT.description: Scripting Serial port to use for the LTE modem. This is the index of the SCR_SDEV ports that are set to 2 for "MAVLink2"

LTE_SERVER_IP0.description: First octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP1.description: Second octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP2.description: Third octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_IP3.description: Fourth octet of the server IP address to connect to

LTE_SERVER_PORT.description: IPv4 Port of the server to connect to

LTE_BAUD.description: Baud rate for the serial port to the LTE modem when connected. Initial power on baudrate is in LTE_IBAUD

LTE_TIMEOUT.description: Timeout in seconds for the LTE connection. If no data is received for this time, the connection will be reset. A value of zero disables the timeout

LTE_PROTOCOL.description: The protocol that we will use in communication with the LTE modem. If this is PPP then the LTE_SERVER parameters are not used and instead a PPP connection will be established and you should use the NET_ parameters to enable network ports. If this is MAVLink2 then the LTE_SERVER parameters are used to create a TCP or UDP connection to a single server.

LTE_OPTIONS.description: Options to control the LTE modem driver. If VerboseSignalInfoGCS is set then additional NAMED_VALUE_FLOAT values are sent with verbose signal information

LTE_IBAUD.description: This is the initial baud rate on power on for the modem. This is set in the modem with the AT+IREX=baud command

LTE_MCCMNC.description: This allows selection of network operator

LTE_TX_RATE.description: Maximum data transmit rate to the modem in bytes/second. Use zero for unlimited

LTE_BAND.description: This allows selection of LTE band. A value of -1 means no band setting change is made. A value of 0 sets all bands. Otherwise the specified band is set.

ESC_HW_POLES.description: Number of motor poles for eRPM scaling

ESC_HW_OFS.description: Motor number offset of first ESC

TOFSENSE_PRX.display_name: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
TOFSENSE_PRX.description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

TOFSENSE_NO.description: Number of TOFSENSE-M CAN sensors connected

TOFSENSE_MODE.description: TOFSENSE-M mode to be used. 0 for 8x8 mode. 1 for 4x4 mode

TOFSENSE_INST1.description: First TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 1 will pick the first backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_ID1.description: First TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. Leave this at 0 to accept all IDs and if only one sensor is present. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_INST2.description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 2 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_ID2.description: Second TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_INST3.description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensors backend Instance. Setting this to 3 will pick the second backend from PRX_ or RNG_ Parameters (Depending on TOFSENSE_PRX)

TOFSENSE_ID3.description: Third TOFSENSE-M sensor ID. This cannot be 0. You can change ID of sensor from NAssistant Software

TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.display_name: TOFSENSE-M to be used as Proximity sensor
TOFSENSE_S1_PRX.description: Set 0 if sensor is to be used as a 1-D rangefinder (minimum of all distances will be sent, typically used for height detection). Set 1 if it should be used as a 3-D proximity device (Eg. Obstacle Avoidance)

TOFSENSE_S1_SP.description: UART instance sensor is connected to. Set 1 if sensor is connected to the port with fist SERIALx_PROTOCOL = 28.

TOFSENSE_S1_BR.description: Serial Port baud rate. Sensor baud rate can be changed from Nassistant software

AFS_ENABLE.description: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

AFS_MAN_PIN.description: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode.  See the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

AFS_HB_PIN.description: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

AFS_WP_COMMS.description: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

AFS_WP_GPS_LOSS.description: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

AFS_TERMINATE.description: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

AFS_TERM_ACTION.description: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup ArduPilot to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

AFS_TERM_PIN.description: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination. Some common values are given, but see the Wiki's "GPIOs" page for how to determine the pin number for a given autopilot.

AFS_AMSL_LIMIT.description: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.display_name: Error margin for GPS based AMSL limit
AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.description: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.

AFS_QNH_PRESSURE.description: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.display_name: Maximum number of GPS loss events
AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.description: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.

AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.display_name: Maximum number of comms loss events
AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.description: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.

AFS_GEOFENCE.description: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_RC.description: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.display_name: Enable RC Termination only in manual control modes
AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.description: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.

AFS_DUAL_LOSS.display_name: Enable dual loss terminate due to failure of both GCS and GPS simultaneously
AFS_DUAL_LOSS.description: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.

AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME.description: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

AFS_MAX_RANGE.description: This is the maximum range of the vehicle in kilometers from first arming. If the vehicle goes beyond this range then the TERM_ACTION is performed. A value of zero disables this feature.

AFS_OPTIONS.description: See description for each bitmask bit description

bitmask.0: Continue the mission even after comms are recovered (does not go to the mission item at the time comms were lost)
bitmask.1: Enable AFS for all autonomous modes (not just AUTO)
bitmask.2: Option to not jump to AFS_WP_COMMS if already in the return path

AFS_GCS_TIMEOUT.description: The time (in seconds) of persistent data link loss before GCS failsafe occurs.

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_USE.display_name: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
AHRS_GPS_USE.description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

AHRS_YAW_P.description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

AHRS_RP_P.description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_WIND_MAX.description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor by clipping it to groundspeed plus/minus this limit. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_WIND_MAX to disable airspeed sensors.

AHRS_TRIM_X.description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle. Firmware versions 4.2 and prior can use a CUSTOM (100) rotation to set the AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles for AHRS orientation. Later versions provide two general custom rotations which can be used, Custom 1 and Custom 2, with CUST_ROT1_ROLL/PIT/YAW or CUST_ROT2_ROLL/PIT/YAW angles.

AHRS_COMP_BETA.display_name: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.display_name: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_OPTIONS.description: This controls optional AHRS behaviour. Setting DisableDCMFallbackFW will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in fly-forward flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DisableDCMFallbackVTOL will change the AHRS behaviour for fixed wing aircraft in non fly-forward (VTOL) flight to not fall back to DCM when the EKF stops navigating. Setting DontDisableAirspeedUsingEKF disables the EKF based innovation check for airspeed consistency

AIS_LIST_MAX.description: AIS list size of nearest vessels. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

AIS_TIME_OUT.description: if no updates are received in this time a vessel will be removed from the list

ARMING_REQUIRE.description: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately).  If 1, all checks specified by ARMING_CHECKS must pass before the vehicle can be armed (for example, via rudder stick or GCS command).  If 3, Arm immediately once pre-arm/arm checks are satisfied, but only one time per boot up.  Note that a reboot is NOT required when setting to 0 but IS require when setting to 3.

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_RUDDER.description: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ). Depending on vehicle type, arming in certain modes is prevented. See the wiki for each vehicle. Caution is recommended when arming if it is allowed in an auto-throttle mode!

ARMING_MIS_ITEMS.description: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

ARMING_CHECK.description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 1 (all checks enabled). You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.

ARMING_OPTIONS.description: Options that can be applied to change arming behaviour

bitmask.1: Do not send status text on state change
bitmask.2: Skip IMU consistency checks when ICE motor running

ARMING_MAGTHRESH.display_name: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model
ARMING_MAGTHRESH.description: Compass magnetic field strength error threshold vs earth magnetic model.  X and y axis are compared using this threhold, Z axis uses 2x this threshold.  0 to disable check

ARMING_CRSDP_IGN.description: Must have value "1" if crashdump data is present on the system, or a prearm failure will be raised.  Do not set this parameter unless the risks of doing so are fully understood.  The presence of a crash dump means that the firmware currently installed has suffered a critical software failure which resulted in the autopilot immediately rebooting.  The crashdump file gives diagnostic information which can help in finding the issue, please contact the ArduPIlot support team.  If this crashdump data is present, the vehicle is likely unsafe to fly.  Check the ArduPilot documentation for more details.

ARMING_NEED_LOC.description: Require that the vehicle have an absolute position before it arms.  This can help ensure that the vehicle can Return To Launch.

ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER.description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD_PRIMARY.description: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

ARSPD_OPTIONS.description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_WIND_MAX.display_name: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference
ARSPD_WIND_MAX.description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_WIND_WARN.display_name: Airspeed and GPS speed difference that gives a warning
ARSPD_WIND_WARN.description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_WIND_GATE.description: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle.

ARSPD_OFF_PCNT.description: The maximum percentage speed change in airspeed reports that is allowed due to offset changes between calibrations before a warning is issued. This potential speed error is in percent of AIRSPEED_MIN. 0 disables. Helps warn of calibrations without pitot being covered.

ARSPD2_USE.description: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD2_RATIO.description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSPD2_PIN.description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.display_name: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD2_AUTOCAL.description: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR.description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.display_name: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL.description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration or requiring a manual calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.display_name: The PSI range of the device
ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE.description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

ARSPD2_BUS.description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

ARSPD2_DEVID.description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD3_USE.description: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD3_RATIO.description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSPD3_PIN.description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

ARSPD3_AUTOCAL.display_name: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD3_BUS.description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

ARSPD3_DEVID.description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD6_AUTOCAL.description: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

ARSPD6_TUBE_ORDR.description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD6_SKIP_CAL.display_name: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
ARSPD6_SKIP_CAL.description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration or requiring a manual calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

ARSPD6_PSI_RANGE.display_name: The PSI range of the device
ARSPD6_PSI_RANGE.description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

ARSPD6_BUS.description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

ARSPD6_DEVID.description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ARSPD_USE.description: This parameter is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.

ARSPD_RATIO.description: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

ARSPD_PIN.description: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Values for some autopilots are given as examples. Search wiki for "Analog pins".

ARSPD_AUTOCAL.display_name: This parameter and function is not used by this vehicle. Always set to 0.
ARSPD_AUTOCAL.description: Enables automatic adjustment of airspeed ratio during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

ARSPD_TUBE_ORDR.description: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

ARSPD_SKIP_CAL.display_name: Skip airspeed offset calibration on startup
ARSPD_SKIP_CAL.description: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration or requiring a manual calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

ARSPD_PSI_RANGE.display_name: The PSI range of the device
ARSPD_PSI_RANGE.description: This parameter allows you to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

ARSPD_BUS.description: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected. May not correspond to board's I2C bus number labels. Retry another bus and reboot if airspeed sensor fails to initialize.

ARSPD_DEVID.description: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

ATC_STR_RAT_P.description: Steering control rate P gain.  Converts the turn rate error (in radians/sec) to a steering control output (in the range -1 to +1)

ATC_STR_RAT_I.description: Steering control I gain.  Corrects long term error between the desired turn rate (in rad/s) and actual

ATC_STR_RAT_IMAX.description: Steering control I gain maximum.  Constrains the steering output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

ATC_STR_RAT_D.description: Steering control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired turn rate vs actual

ATC_STR_RAT_FILT.description: Steering control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_STR_RAT_FLTT.display_name: Steering control Target filter frequency in Hz

ATC_STR_RAT_FLTE.display_name: Steering control Error filter frequency in Hz

ATC_STR_RAT_FLTD.display_name: Steering control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz

ATC_STR_RAT_SMAX.description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_STR_RAT_PDMX.description: Steering control PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

ATC_STR_RAT_D_FF.description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_STR_RAT_NTF.display_name: Steering control Target notch filter index
ATC_STR_RAT_NTF.description: Steering control Target notch filter index

ATC_STR_RAT_NEF.display_name: Steering control Error notch filter index
ATC_STR_RAT_NEF.description: Steering control Error notch filter index

ATC_SPEED_P.description: Speed control P gain.  Converts the error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed to a motor output (in the range -1 to +1)

ATC_SPEED_I.description: Speed control I gain.  Corrects long term error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed

ATC_SPEED_IMAX.description: Speed control I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

ATC_SPEED_D.description: Speed control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual

ATC_SPEED_FILT.description: Speed control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_SPEED_FLTT.display_name: Speed control Target filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SPEED_FLTE.display_name: Speed control Error filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SPEED_FLTD.display_name: Speed control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SPEED_SMAX.description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_SPEED_PDMX.description: Speed control PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

ATC_SPEED_D_FF.description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_SPEED_NTF.display_name: Speed control Target notch filter index
ATC_SPEED_NTF.description: Speed control Target notch filter index

ATC_SPEED_NEF.display_name: Speed control Error notch filter index
ATC_SPEED_NEF.description: Speed control Error notch filter index

ATC_ACCEL_MAX.display_name: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s
ATC_ACCEL_MAX.description: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s.  0 to disable acceleration limiting

ATC_BRAKE.description: Speed control brake enable/disable. Allows sending a reversed output to the motors to slow the vehicle.

ATC_STOP_SPEED.description: Speed control stop speed.  Motor outputs to zero once vehicle speed falls below this value

ATC_STR_ANG_P.description: Steering control angle P gain.  Converts the error between the desired heading/yaw (in radians) and actual heading/yaw to a desired turn rate (in rad/sec)

ATC_STR_ACC_MAX.description: Steering control angular acceleration maximum (in deg/s/s).  0 to disable acceleration limiting

ATC_STR_RAT_MAX.description: Steering control rotation rate maximum in deg/s.  0 to remove rate limiting

ATC_DECEL_MAX.display_name: Speed control deceleration maximum in m/s/s
ATC_DECEL_MAX.description: Speed control and deceleration maximum in m/s/s.  0 to use ATC_ACCEL_MAX for deceleration

ATC_BAL_P.description: Pitch control P gain for BalanceBots.  Converts the error between the desired pitch (in radians) and actual pitch to a motor output (in the range -1 to +1)

ATC_BAL_I.description: Pitch control I gain for BalanceBots.  Corrects long term error between the desired pitch (in radians) and actual pitch

ATC_BAL_IMAX.description: Pitch control I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum motor output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

ATC_BAL_D.description: Pitch control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch vs actual

ATC_BAL_FILT.description: Pitch control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_BAL_FLTT.display_name: Pitch control Target filter frequency in Hz
ATC_BAL_FLTT.description: Pitch control Target filter frequency in Hz

ATC_BAL_FLTE.display_name: Pitch control Error filter frequency in Hz
ATC_BAL_FLTE.description: Pitch control Error filter frequency in Hz

ATC_BAL_FLTD.display_name: Pitch control Derivative term filter frequency in Hz
ATC_BAL_FLTD.description: Pitch control Derivative filter frequency in Hz

ATC_BAL_SMAX.description: Pitch control upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_BAL_PDMX.description: Pitch control PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

ATC_BAL_D_FF.description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_BAL_NTF.display_name: Pitch control Target notch filter index
ATC_BAL_NTF.description: Pitch control Target notch filter index

ATC_BAL_NEF.display_name: Pitch control Error notch filter index
ATC_BAL_NEF.description: Pitch control Error notch filter index

ATC_BAL_PIT_FF.display_name: Pitch control feed forward from current pitch angle
ATC_BAL_PIT_FF.description: Pitch control feed forward from current pitch angle

ATC_SAIL_P.description: Sail Heel control P gain for sailboats.  Converts the error between the desired heel angle (in radians) and actual heel to a main sail output (in the range -1 to +1)

ATC_SAIL_I.description: Sail Heel control I gain for sailboats.  Corrects long term error between the desired heel angle (in radians) and actual

ATC_SAIL_IMAX.display_name: Sail Heel control I gain maximum
ATC_SAIL_IMAX.description: Sail Heel control I gain maximum.  Constrains the maximum I term contribution to the main sail output (range -1 to +1)

ATC_SAIL_D.description: Sail Heel control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired heel angle vs actual

ATC_SAIL_FILT.description: Sail Heel control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_SAIL_FLTT.display_name: Sail Heel Target filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SAIL_FLTE.display_name: Sail Heel Error filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SAIL_FLTD.display_name: Sail Heel Derivative term filter frequency in Hz

ATC_SAIL_SMAX.description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

ATC_SAIL_PDMX.display_name: Sail Heel control PD sum maximum
ATC_SAIL_PDMX.description: Sail Heel control PD sum maximum.  The maximum/minimum value that the sum of the P and D term can output

ATC_SAIL_D_FF.description: FF D Gain which produces an output that is proportional to the rate of change of the target

ATC_SAIL_NTF.display_name: Sail Heel Target notch filter index
ATC_SAIL_NTF.description: Sail Heel Target notch filter index

ATC_SAIL_NEF.display_name: Sail Heel Error notch filter index
ATC_SAIL_NEF.description: Sail Heel Error notch filter index

ATC_TURN_MAX_G.description: The maximum turning acceleration (in units of gravities) that the rover can handle while remaining stable. The navigation code will keep the lateral acceleration below this level to avoid rolling over or slipping the wheels in turns

ATC_BAL_LIM_TC.description: Pitch control limit time constant to protect against falling.  Lower values limit pitch more quickly, higher values limit more slowly.  Set to 0 to disable

ATC_BAL_LIM_THR.description: Pitch control limit throttle threshold.  Pitch angle will be limited if throttle crosses this threshold (from 0 to 1)

ATC_STR_DEC_MAX.description: Steering control angular deceleration maximum (in deg/s/s).  0 to disable deceleration limiting

AVOID_MARGIN.display_name: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes
AVOID_MARGIN.description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

AVOID_BACKUP_SPD.description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles horizontally in position control modes (m/s). Set zero to disable horizontal backup.

AVOID_ACCEL_MAX.description: Maximum acceleration with which obstacles will be avoided with. Set zero to disable acceleration limits

AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.display_name: Avoidance deadzone between stopping and backing away from obstacle
AVOID_BACKUP_DZ.description: Distance beyond AVOID_MARGIN parameter, after which vehicle will backaway from obstacles. Increase this parameter if you see vehicle going back and forth in front of obstacle.

AVOID_BACKZ_SPD.description: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles vertically in height control modes (m/s). Set zero to disable vertical backup.

BARO_GND_TEMP.description: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

BARO_ALT_OFFSET.description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

BARO_PRIMARY.description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

BARO_EXT_BUS.description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the BARO_PROBE_EXT parameter.

BARO_FLTR_RNG.display_name: Range in which sample is accepted
BARO_FLTR_RNG.description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

BARO_PROBE_EXT.description: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on BARO_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in BARO_EXT_BUS.

BARO1_DEVID.description: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO2_DEVID.description: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO3_DEVID.description: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

BARO_FIELD_ELV.description: User provided field elevation in meters. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. Changes to this parameter will only be used when disarmed. A value of 0 means the EKF origin height is used for takeoff height above sea level.

BARO_ALTERR_MAX.description: This is the maximum acceptable altitude discrepancy between GPS altitude and barometric presssure altitude calculated against a standard atmosphere for arming checks to pass. If you are getting an arming error due to this parameter then you may have a faulty or substituted barometer. A common issue is vendors replacing a MS5611 in a "Pixhawk" with a MS5607. If you have that issue then please see BARO_OPTIONS parameter to force the MS5611 to be treated as a MS5607. This check is disabled if the value is zero.

BARO1_THST_SCALE.description: Thrust scaling in Pascals. This value scaled by the normalized thrust is subtracted from the barometer pressure. This is used to adjust linearly based on the thrust output for local pressure difference induced by the props.

BARO1_WCF_ENABLE.description: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

BARO1_WCF_FWD.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
BARO1_WCF_FWD.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BARO1_WCF_BCK.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
BARO1_WCF_BCK.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BARO1_WCF_RGT.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
BARO1_WCF_RGT.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BARO1_WCF_LFT.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
BARO1_WCF_LFT.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BARO1_WCF_UP.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in positive Z direction (up)
BARO1_WCF_UP.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during climbing flight (or forward flight with a high forwards lean angle), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

BARO1_WCF_DN.display_name: Pressure error coefficient in negative Z direction (down)
BARO1_WCF_DN.description: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Z body axis. If the baro height estimate rises above truth height during descending flight (or forward flight with a high backwards lean angle, eg braking manoeuvre), then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_X and EK3_DRAG_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.
